main event: On 6 February 1956 in San Fernando, California, an observer reported a single, circular object, yellowish-white in color, the size of a pinhead at arm's length, moving at 500 knots from southwest to northeast.
interesting points: The object was described as moving at a very high speed of 500 knots.
The observer compared the size of the object to that of a pinhead at arm's length.
The Air Force concluded this was likely an aircraft sighting.
The record card contained details such as the date, time, location, and length of observation.
The report was classified as unclassified.
sighted object: single, circular object moving at 500 knots
witnesses: one observer, 22 years old, spot welder
